position_notation.description: Positions are HIGH-LEVEL GUIDANCE, not strict requirements. App-wide optimizations that improve UX or reduce complexity are encouraged.
position_notation.mobile_app_grid: Grid numbered left-to-right, top-to-bottom. 5 rows × 5 columns (25 positions): 1=top-left, 5=top-right, 21=bottom-left, 25=bottom-right
position_notation.macro_position: screen number (which screen the feature appears on)
position_notation.micro_position: grid_position within screen (where on the screen)

spec_structure.title: Feature name
spec_structure.positions: Where this feature appears across screens

codegen_contract.feature_to_component_rule: Each spec entry maps to a reusable component under /components/features or /components/ui. Screens compose features.
codegen_contract.do_not_invent_features: Only implement features listed in specs[].
codegen_contract.positions_are_guidance: Grid positions are guidance; preserve relative hierarchy (header/top, primary content center, primary CTA bottom).

specs.title: titleofwebsite
specs.description: This is a title for the website, which should say "Sidharth ✦ Sirdeshmukh ✦ Drug Discovery ✦ Lab Automation ✦ Software ✦" following the conventions specified in the code unit below

specs.title: menu
specs.description: This should be a drop down menu on the left hand side of the page. When expanded, you should see 1) Writing 2) Projects 3) Resume 4) Bio. Design this region according to the code unit below.

specs.title: background
specs.description: Use the code unit below as guidance for the gradient style background for the entire website.

specs.title: menuspecificheader
specs.description: For the menu item that the user clicks on, the title of the page should change to the menu item. For example, clicking on the 'Resume' menu item should make sure that the title of the page (and of course the page itself) is titled and belongs to Resume...
